abstract: Altria announced in a filing with the S.E.C. that it had resolved a tax issue stemming from disagreements over leasing transactions.
snippet: Altria announced in a filing with the S.E.C. that it had resolved a tax issue stemming from disagreements over leasing transactions.
lead_paragraph: The Altria Group, the nation’s largest tobacco company, announced on Tuesday that it would pay $971 million to resolve a tax dispute concerning leasing transactions in the years 2000 through 2003.

headline.main: Altria to Pay $971 Million to Resolve a Tax Dispute
headline.print_headline: Altria to Pay $971 Million To Resolve a Tax Dispute
